intro: Mesosphaerum actinocephalum, commonly known as the star-headed mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and other shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it has specific horticultural requirements.
